hadiths.text: It was narrated that 'Amr bin Dinar said:I said to Tawus: “O Abu 'Abdur-Rahman, why do you not give up this Mukhabarah because they claim that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) forbade it.” He said: “O 'Amr, I help them by taking their land and cultivating it, and giving them something in return, and Mu`adh bin Jabal allowed people here to do that. The most knowledgeable of them - meaning Ibn`Abbas - told me that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) did not forbid it, rather he said: 'For one you to give (land) to his brother is better than if he were to take a set amount in rent for it.'”

chapter.ara-name: باب الرُّخْصَةِ فِي الْمُزَارَعَةِ بِالثُّلُثِ وَالرُّبُعِ
chapter.eng-name: Concession Allowing Cultivation for One Third And One Quarter (Of The Crop)
